H0.text: The polar ice caps will melt as the amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere increases, which is the most likely long‑term result.

H1.text: Volcanoes will erupt more often is the long‑term result most likely to occur as the amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere increases.

H2.text: The number of earthquakes will decrease is the most likely long‑term result as the amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere increases.

H3.text: Rainforests will be unable to support animal life is the most likely long‑term result as the amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere increases.

A4.text: Polar ice caps have shown their most rapid decline in size with no true sign of recovery.

A5.text: Arctic has been losing around 50 cubic kilometres (gigatons) of land ice per year, almost entirely from Greenland's 2.6 million gigaton sheet.
